intro: Erodium australe, commonly known as the Australian filaree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its seeds are small and triangular in shape. Erodium australe is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
